data.name: Check for Allergies
data.description:
## checkForAllergies

You receive a list of all the customers for a table in the restaurant. You need to check the array of customers to see if at least one of them has an allergy.

In this kata, a customer will be represented by an object with a `name` property and an `allergies` property, like below:
```js
{
  name: 'Anat',
  allergies: ['nuts']
}
```
If a customer **doesn't have an allergy**, then the `allergies` property value will be an empty array, like below:
```js
{
  name: 'Harpreet',
  allergies: []
}
```

• The function `checkForAllergies` will take an array of customer objects.

• If at least one of the customers in the array has an allergy then the `checkForAllergies` should return `true` overall. Otherwise, if none of the customers has an allergy, then `checkForAllergies` should return `false` overall. For example:

```js
checkForAllergies([
  { customer: 'Paul C', allergies: [] },
  { customer: 'Wendy', allergies: [] },
  { customer: 'Anat', allergies: [] }
]); // should return false (noone has any allergies)
```

```js
checkForAllergies([
  { customer: 'Hannah', allergies: [] },
  { customer: 'Wendy', allergies: [] },
  { customer: 'Paul C', allergies: [] },
  { customer: 'Jonny', allergies: [] },
  { customer: 'Harpreet', allergies: [ 'nuts' ] }
]); // should return true (Harpreet has a nuts allergy)
```
